derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French ablative (feminine of ablatif), Latin ablativus, from ablat- 'taken away' (see ablation)

means.word_mean: 1. the case indicating the agent in passive sentences or the instrument or manner or place of the action described by the verb
2. tending to ablate; i.e. to be removed or vaporized at very high temperature;
